children.text: NameDateReason for Change

Describe the current project and its context and contents. This document is completely voluntary and is not required by any standard, but completing and maintaining this document might help new project members to find their way around.

The interested user should update this document to reflect the specific project. Another option is to delete this document. Deletion should be done only after the user creates the first project document, since ReqView currently does not support empty projects (i.e. a project without documents in it).
This paragraph should provide a description (usually with  the help of a diagram) of the project organization and structure.
The project contains (or will contain) the following documents, in the following groups:
Complete this section according to your project, describing shortly each document.

The ReqView project also defines the traceability link types that can be used across document objects in the project.

When using linked projects (i.e. creating an hierarchical project structure that includes a main project and multiple sub-projects, potentially at multiple levels of hierarchy), traceability links can be used across document objects in all sub projects. In this case, it is important that the the traceability link types defined in all ReqView projects that are included in the real project will be identical.

This ReqView project defines the following traceability link types:

children.heading: Satisfaction Links
children.text:
Satisfaction links lead from downstream requirements to the related higher level requirements, where the down stream requirement fully satisfies the upper link requirement (M:1).

In the case that an upper level requirement is satisfied by several downstream requirements, each satisfying only a part of the upper level requirement, use the Derivation link type.

children.heading: Derivation Links
children.text: Derivation links lead from downstream requirements to the related upper stream requirements, in the case that the down stream requirement satisfies part of the upper stream requirement (M:N).

children.heading: Mitigation Links
children.text: Mitigation links lead from requirements at risk to the related project risk reduction actions in the project risk management plan (M:N).

children.heading: Verification Links
children.text: Verification links lead from a test case or test description in a test/verification plan or test description document to the related requirement that is tests (M:N).

children.heading: Implementation Links
children.text: Implementation links lead from a component or functionality in a downstream document that implements an upper level requirement (M:N).

children.heading: Reference Links
children.text: Reference links lead from an object in a downstream document to an upper level object that it references and that this reference has documental value (M:N).
